DataElement.preferredName: Ontology Identification Term Accession Number Source Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the source from where a term is selected and referenced in the ISA-TAB-Nano files. The source could be an ontology or a controlled vocabulary. The source name is the full name or the acronym of the ontology/controlled vocabulary. This is a required field if the term source name is referenced in any of the ISA-TAB-Nano files.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The word ontology has a long history in philosophy, in which it refers to the study of being as such. In information science, an ontology is an explicit formal specification of how to represent the objects, concepts and other entities that are assumed to exist in some area of interest and the relationships among them._The procedure of having an identity established.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: In information science, an explicit formal specification of how to represent the objects, concepts and other entities that are assumed to exist in some area of interest and the relationships among them.

Concepts.definition: A terminology that includes explicit formal specification of how to represent the objects, concepts, relationships, and other entities that are in the terminology.

Property.preferredDefinition: Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: The procedure of having an identity established.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Name of the ontology or controlled vocabulary from which a term is selected.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A word or expression used for some particular thing.:A control number unique to an object, used to identify it among the other objects in a collection.:Where something is available or from where it originates. :The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A word or expression used for some particular thing.
A control number unique to an object.  It is used to identify the object among other objects in a collection.
Where something is available or from where it originates.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueDomain.origin: ISA-TAB-Nano:Investigation Study Assay Excel Table Format for Nanotechnology

ReferenceDocuments.name: NCIt:NCI Thesaurus
ReferenceDocuments.description: NCIt is a reference terminology covering vocabulary for clinical care, translational and basic research, and public information and administrative activities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NPO:NanoParticle Ontology
ReferenceDocuments.description: An ontology that represents the basic knowledge of physical, chemical and functional characteristics of nanotechnology as used in cancer diagnosis and therapy.

ReferenceDocuments.name: chEBI:Chemical Entities of Biological Interest
ReferenceDocuments.description: A structured classification focused on 'small' chemical compounds of biological relevance.

ReferenceDocuments.name: UO:Unit Ontology
ReferenceDocuments.description: An ontology currently being used in many scientific resources for the standardized description of units of measure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: MO:MGED Ontology
ReferenceDocuments.description: A resource for semantics-based description of microarray experiments.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PATO:Phenotype Ontology
ReferenceDocuments.description: This ontology can be used in conjunction with other ontologies such as GO or anatomical ontologies to refer to phenotypes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: OBI:Ontology for Biomedical Investigations
ReferenceDocuments.description: An integrated ontology for the description of life-science and clinical investigations.

ReferenceDocuments.name: EFO:Experimental Factor Ontology
ReferenceDocuments.description: A systematic description of many experimental variables that combines parts of several biological ontologies, such as anatomy, disease and chemical compounds.

ReferenceDocuments.name: MedDRA:Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities Terminology
ReferenceDocuments.description: A medical terminology used to classify adverse event information associated with the use of biopharmaceuticals and other medical products.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ERO:eagle-i research resource ontology
ReferenceDocuments.description: An ontology that models research resources such as instruments, protocols, reagents, animal models and biospecimens.

ReferenceDocuments.name: MMO:Measurement Method Ontology
ReferenceDocuments.description: An ontology that represents the variety of methods used to make qualitative and quantitative clincial and phenotype measurements both in the clinic and with model organisms.

DataElement.origin: ISA-TAB-Nano:Investigation Study Assay Excel Table Format for Nanotechnology
